text: Corner Gas was a Canadian sitcom that was on television from 2004 to 2009. It was set in the fictional town of Dog River, Saskatchewan and was shot in Rouleau, Saskatchewan. It stared Canadian comic Brent Butt. On April 6, 2009, Saskatchewan premier Brad Wall declared that April 13 would be "Corner Gas Day" in Saskatchewan. The show has won numerous awards and nominations including: 9 Canadian Comedy Awards and 6 Gemini Awards, It has also been nominated for an International Emmy Award in 2004. In 2014, Corner Gas: The Movie, a movie based off the show was released. A revival of the show Corner Gas Animated ran from April 2, 2018 until November 1, 2021. ==References== ==Other websites== * Corner Gas' Official website * Corner Gas' Comedy Network profile Category:2000s sitcoms Category:Saskatchewan Category:2000s Canadian television series debuts Category:2004 television series debuts Category:2009 Canadian television series endings
title: Corner Gas
